data.title: node children draw out of order
data.body: I can't upload an example project for this at the moment, because the hosting service is failing for some reason.  But it's very simple.  Add a Node2D as a root node.  Add to this two children: a Node, and a Sprite.  To the Node, add a sprite child.  Though the Node and its sprite child come first in the tree, the sprite draws on top of the original sprite.

data.title: Several feature requests for improving the experience of making tile maps
data.body:
This is a feature request for improving the way Godot allows users to paint tiles in TileMap nodes. I hope these features make it before version 1.0 is released.
1.  brush sizes: Changing the brush size would be useful if you need to paint large extensions of your TileMap node.
2.  search by name TileSet palette: You have to scroll up or down to find the tile you want to use for painting, by writing the name of the tile you want you could narrow the collection of tiles shown to find the one you need, quickly.
3.  rectangular drawing: By clicking a place and dragging the mouse, making a rectangle, the user can paint large extensions of the TileMap node at will.
4.  eraser sizes and rectangular deleting: like feature 1 and 3 but for erasing things from your TileMap.
5.  Terrain Tool: This is a feature on Tiled. As they explain it in [their wiki](https://github.com/bjorn/tiled/wiki/Using-the-Terrain-Tool): _Starting with Tiled 0.9.0, a new tool was added specifically to make editing tile maps easier when using terrain transitions. There are of course multiple ways to do transitions between tiles. The Terrain tool in Tiled supports transition tiles that have a well-defined terrain type at each of their 4 corners, which seems to be the most common method._
6.  random tiles, a brush mode: A mode that allows the brush to use many different tiles to paint randomly an area of TileMap, Tiled have a brush specifically for this, but I think that allowing this to be use in both feature request 3 besides the usual brush (but able to change its size as asked in feature request 1) is way better.
7.  Automapping: This is another feature on Tiled. Again, as they explain it in [their wiki](https://github.com/bjorn/tiled/wiki/Automapping#what-is-automapping): _Automapping is an advanced tool to automatically search certain combinations of tiles across layers in a map and to replace these parts by other combination. This allows the user to draw structures with a minimum of time spent and the Automapping will be able to generate a rather complex scenario, which would need lots more time if manually crafted. So the goal of Automapping is that you only need to draw within one layer and everything else is setup for you. This brings some advantages:_
   -   _working speed - you need less time to setup a map._
   -   _less errors - the main reason is to reduce the error rate. If you have setup the rules properly, there is no hidden error._
8.  Stamp brush tool: another feature from Tiled, you can select many different tiles and paint such selection, as is, to paint the TileMap node. In Tiled you can [create brushes](https://github.com/bjorn/tiled/wiki/Best-Practices#creating-a-brush) (so you don't have to repeatedly select different groups of tiles).

don't forget to tag this issue as "whishlist". Thanks!

data.title: if you try to scroll down more than there is text in your file, Godot will crash
data.body:
Hello!

You wouldn't waste 10 seconds of you life figuring out this bug! (cof cof #366 cof cof)

1- Open Godot, then open any project
2- create a script, start editing it.
3- Godot should show the scroll bar so you can scroll up and down even thought you don't need it because your text is short
4- scroll down until you hit the bottom.
5- Godot should crash before you hit the bottom of the file

data.title: Animations in copied Animation Players can not be edited separately
data.body:
I made a Sprite3d with an Animation Player.
Made some animations.
Then copied the Sprite3D node.
The animations in the two Animations Players are now shared.
When editing the animations in the copied Animation Player, the ones in the original Animation Player are also changed. Or rather, they are the same animation.

I had to copy and rename each animation to make them separate.

data.title: Animation loaded from file does not save changes
data.body:
I saved some animations (made in the Animation Player) as files.
Loaded these animations in another scene in another Animation Player.
Now I can edit these animations, but if I close ad re-open the scene, the changes are lost and the animations seem to have been reloaded from the files.
I had to copy and rename each animation to make them forget the file they came from.

data.title: Selecting Nodes Improvement
data.body:
Since often nodes are layered or overlapping it may be hard to select the wanted node.
Blender offers a great solution for such things, by shift + clicking on an object which results in a dropdown list of all object names that are behind the mouse cursor. This makes selecting the objects much easier and especially if there are many object this is a great solution.

data.body: ...dialog.

data.title: WorldEnvironment Ambient Lighting Only Affects Objects Lit By Other Lights
data.body:
Hey, there. So the problem is that ambient lighting only affects objects lit by existing lights, like Omni or Directional lights. This can be seen in the screenshot I've attached - the point light lights up the tiles near it, correctly, but the Ambient Light only brightens the light level of objects in the bounding box of the Omni Light.

![ambientlightingissues](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4733521/4802284/66791e90-5e41-11e4-8ffb-cd47a1a330e3.png)

This can actually easily be confirmed by just making a scene, making a WorldEnvironment node, and giving some Ambient Lighting - it won't do anything to the scene unless you add another light.

The engine's turning out really well, nonetheless. Thanks a lot for development.

data.title: GDScript: Strage scope priority with arguments to class constructor
data.body:
```
# test.gd
var a = 0
func _init(a):
    print(a)
```

When instantiating the above class, the class member "a" gets priority over the argument "a".

```
var Test = load("test.gd")
Test.new(1)
```

The expected output of the above code is 1, but 0 is printed instead.

data.title: Add spritefonts support
data.body:
The import font dialog is good and it works well with existing fonts. But when I have to draw my own font I actually find it hard to import it. 
The BMFont app from Angelcode to generate .fnt fonts doesn't work and one needs to script a little to create a custom font.

data.body: ...during the first hour of every days, the first minute of every hours and the first second of every minutes.

data.title: New RemoteBlendTransform2D Node.
data.body:
Same as existing RemoteTransform2D except:
- It has a blend factor that can be animated to blend the transform between the original remote object transform (recorded at Assign time) and the current RemoteBlendTransform2D node transform, which can also be animated.
- Remote node is immediately affected once assigned, you don't have to move the RemoteBlendTransform2D in order for the remote node to catch RemoteBlendTransform2D transform.
- When remote node is cleared from RemoteBlendTransform2D "Remote Path" property, or when the RemoteBlendTransform2D is deleted, the original remote node transform is restored.
- If you want the blend be done with another remote transform, you just have to Clear it from RemoteBlendTransform2D "Remote Path" property, move/rotate/scale it, then re-"Assign" it to the RemoteBlendTransform2D node.

data.title: Multiline comments in gdscript
data.body:
There should be a way to make a comment that covers multiple lines so you don't need to add a '#' to every line.

eg
""" 
Line1
Line2
Line3
"""

data.title: Parse Error: Unknown character when using 'bla' instead of "bla" for strings
data.body:
For HTTPClients POST method I'd like to write json as string: '{"key1":0,"key2":1}' but godot gives me a Parse Error: Unknown character.

Even var bla = 'something' gives me the same error though according to wiki 'Hello' and "Hi" should be strings.

Noticed on Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
